This PR is now ready for an initial review. An important note: The way that Category* C works is by looking at the universe parameters in C itself and its type, and placing the new universe param before all of those. OTOH, Category.!{*} C works by creating a level param v, considering Category.{v,_} C, elaborating it as Category.{v,u} C for some u, then placing v before any level params appearing in u. So, if we have C.{u} : Type 0, then Category* C will place v before u while Category.!{*} C will place it after u.

I got Claude to write various tests for this PR. If anyone wants additional tests, let me know and I will happily add them.
Is the ! necessary? It seems nicer if we could avoid it. Otherwise, could you leave a note explaining the obstacle?
It seems to work just fine without the !. I have also added support for @ as @Jovan Gerbscheid requested.
